title: 'In Sudan, it is as if a congenital curse is at work. And the worst is yet to come'
subhead: Straddling the Arab world and Africa, this enduring military dictatorship has seen almost continuous armed conflict since gaining independence in 1956. Its neighbor, the young state of South Sudan, is suffering a similar tragedy, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.
